title: The Unsolved Mystery of ‘Japan’s Atlantis’
content:
Photo: Dr. Robert Schoch/Boston University. 
 
In 1986, a diver on Japan’s Yonaguni Island, the southwestern most of the Ryukyu Island island chain, made an astonishing discovery. A rock formation on the seafloor which he could only liken to Machu Picchu. “I felt a quiver down my spine,” Kihachiro Aratake recalled, to explorer, marine biologist and BBC Television host Monty Halls.
